issue.title: Rclone fails randomly

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hello,

I'm running rclone v1.30 on 64 bit debian wheezy. trying to sync data from nfs mount to s3

Command i used is ./rclone sync --checkers 100 --transfers 30 /import/xxx/yyyy/ xxx-remote:backup

i generated core dump and here is bt full:
(gdb) bt full
#0  0x0000000000462554 in ?? ()

No symbol table info available.
#1  0x00000000004432a8 in ?? ()

No symbol table info available.
#2  0x0000000000000006 in ?? ()

No symbol table info available.
#3  0x0000000000000000 in ?? ()

No symbol table info available.

nfs has ~55TB of data and most of that is already on s3(via snowball). i just wanted to sync differences. sync sometimes fails after 2G transferred and sometimes after 15T transferred. 

If needed i can attach whole traceback from rclone fail, start of it:
unexpected fault address 0x0
fatal error: fault
[signal 0xb code=0x80 addr=0x0 pc=0x410d16]

goroutine 1 [running]:
runtime.throw(0xc11e58, 0x5)
        /usr/local/go/src/runtime/panic.go:547 +0x90 fp=0xc8206c79e8 sp=0xc8206c79d0
runtime.sigpanic()
        /usr/local/go/src/runtime/sigpanic_unix.go:27 +0x2ab fp=0xc8206c7a38 sp=0xc8206c79e8
runtime.mapaccess2_faststr(0x9c6d20, 0xc82044f5c0, 0xc9ce1c29c0, 0x59, 0xcb7dd3fae8, 0xca0837b901)
        /usr/local/go/src/runtime/hashmap_fast.go:382 +0x476 fp=0xc8206c7a98 sp=0xc8206c7a38
github.com/ncw/rclone/fs.syncCopyMove(0x7fca1448df70, 0xc8201988c0, 0x7fca1448dd90, 0xc82015a690, 0x430001, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
        /home/ncw/Code/Go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/fs/operations.go:639 +0x632 fp=0xc8206c7c30 sp=0xc8206c7a98
github.com/ncw/rclone/fs.Sync(0x7fca1448df70, 0xc8201988c0, 0x7fca1448dd90, 0xc82015a690, 0x0, 0x0)
        /home/ncw/Code/Go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/fs/operations.go:669 +0x61 fp=0xc8206c7c80 sp=0xc8206c7c30
main.glob.func2(0x7fca1448df70, 0xc8201988c0, 0x7fca1448dd90, 0xc82015a690, 0x0, 0x0)
        /home/ncw/Code/Go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/rclone.go:83 +0x4b fp=0xc8206c7cb8 sp=0xc8206c7c80
main.main()
        /home/ncw/Code/Go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/rclone.go:486 +0xc04 fp=0xc8206c7f50 sp=0xc8206c7cb8
runtime.main()
        /usr/local/go/src/runtime/proc.go:188 +0x2b0 fp=0xc8206c7fa0 sp=0xc8206c7f50
runtime.goexit()
        /usr/local/go/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:1998 +0x1 fp=0xc8206c7fa8 sp=0xc8206c7fa0

thanks!

issue.title: Google Drive (encrypted): "failed to authenticate decrypted block - bad password?" on files during reading

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

rclone 1.35

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Devuan Linux 1.0 (systemd-free fork of Debian Jessie).

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Google Drive, with the built-in rclone encryption.

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`rclone -v --dump-headers --log-file=LOGFILE copy egd:REDACTED/REDACTED/REDACTED/REDACTED.mp4 /tmp/REDACTED.mp4
`
 

> A log from the command with the `-v` flag (eg output from `rclone -v copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

Please find it attached: [LOGFILE.txt](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/files/691515/LOGFILE.txt)

Note 1: This is related to #677, which is closed and I cannot reopen.
Note 2: These errors are 100% reproducible.

Cheers, 
   Durval.

issue.title: Manage folders

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Some of rclones remote fs do understand the concept of folders, eg
- drive
- local
- dropbox

Make an optional interfaces (eg `Mkdir`, `Rmdir`) for these FS to manage the creation and deletion of folders.  This would enable empty folders, and deletion of empty folders on sync.

issue.title: Sync subdirectories recursively excluding some

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hi Everyone... just tried RClone for the first time. Read for about 20 mins but could not get it straight.

I have a deep directory structure with 1000s of images inside 100s of subdirectories to be sync'd recursively to my Google Drive, but leaving out ./cache and ./thumbnails directory.

## Issue #1 rClone does not copy subdirectories
`rclone sync /synctest/images GDrive:/images`
this ... only sync files in the dir specified
Why is it not sync'ng and creating the directory structure ? What arguments need to be passed to sync all subdir recursive?

## issue #2 How to exclude certain directories
is this right ?
`rclone sync /synctest/images GDrive:/images --exclude "/thumbnails/**"`

I read you can make and load and exclusion file... but if I only need to exclude one or two directories, what will be the right parameter to pass ?

Thanks

issue.title: s3: uploading with no bucket doesn't give a sensible error

milestone.title: Soon
milestone.description: Issues which are a good idea but haven't been assigned a specific release yet.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
This shouldn't be allowed, instead it gives a rather cryptic error

```
$ rclone -v copy /tmp/many_files/file1.tst s3:
2015/11/08 09:57:40 S3 bucket : Modify window is 1ns
2015/11/08 09:57:40 Attempt 1/3 failed with 1 errors and: MethodNotAllowed: The specified method is not allowed against this resource.
    status code: 405, request id:
```

Probably should check all methods in s3, swift and googlecloudstorage that they have a bucket/container where necessary.

issue.title: rClone - Cache problem / Windows / Linux

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

rclone v1.39
os/arch: windows/amd64
go version: go1.9.2

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Windows 10, 64bit

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Google Drive

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

rclone -v mount --allow-non-empty --allow-other --max-read-ahead 200M --drive-chunk-size 128M --checkers 40 --dir-cache-time 30m --transfers=32 google1: /cloud_drive/googlestorage1 &

```
2018/01/24 03:42:28 ERROR : winfsp-1.2.17346.msi: WriteFileHandle: Truncate: Can't change size without cache
2018/01/24 03:42:38 ERROR : winfsp-1.2.17346.msi: WriteFileHandle: ReadAt: Can't read and write to file without cache 
```

I had 3 different problems at the moment. 1 is already solved. 

I think the main problem is the cache option on my systems. On Windows i get always the errors your can see above. 

The second problem is when i stream from my root server i can stream with this mount "4k" without anyproblems directly out of my google drive. I started setting up a new server with ubuntu 16.04. and setup rClone, but from this server it is impossible to stream cause the stream is wholte time freezing. I think it is not a hardware problem cause those are dedicated 4 and 8 core servers, i think it is a big cache problem with mounting. 

#1 Informations the main linux system: (all working perfectly including streaming): 
Intel G850
32 GB Ram
8 TB HDD
10 Gbit/s

#2 Informations about second linux system: (streaming not possible, whole files lagging, freezing):
Ubuntu 16.04. -64 Bit
Intel C2750 Avoton - 16 GB RAM and SSD for Hostsystem. 
1 Gbit/s

#3 Informations about my windows system: (Truncate Error with reading/writing files on the drive):
AMD Ryzen1800x
32 GB Ram
M2 SSD
200 MBit/s

Any idea which options i can try for streaming from linux and using my crypted rClone drive over windows for moving files on it ?

Best Regards

issue.title: Where is the cache files? [Seemingly stupid question.] :)

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
I am trying to see the cache files come in, and also remove themselves after the time allocated in the cache window.

I have set a custom cache db path (--cache-db-path=/volume1/rclone_cache) in my mount command i use.  From reading the mount wiki, the cache db chunks follow the db path but append the remote to the end so my cache should be in /volume1/rclone_cache/cache (as cache is my remote name).  and it is...

i see both cache.db and cache directory (in /volume1/rclone_cache).
when i go into the cache directory, i also get all of the directories.

however, when i am playing a video, i monitor the directory and i see the modified timestamp change, but never do i see any files in the directory.  My presumption were that they were hidden, however they are not.  

for example:
```
ash-4.3# cd /volume1/Data/rclone_cache/Movies/Ferdinand\ \(2017\)/
ash-4.3# ls -lt
total 0
drwxr-xr-x 1 root root 0 Jul 16 12:28 Ferdinand (2017) [BLURAY-1080P PROPER][AAC 5.1][X264]-RARBG.mp4
drwxr-xr-x 1 root root 0 Jul  9 03:38 Ferdinand (2017) [BLURAY-2160P][TRUEHD 7.1][X264]-POOP.mkv
drwxr-xr-x 1 root root 0 Jul  8 21:00 Ferdinand (2017) - [BLURAY-1080P][DTS 5.1][X264]-DRONES.mkv
ash-4.3# cd Ferdinand\ \(2017\)\ \[BLURAY-1080P\ PROPER\]\[AAC\ 5.1\]\[X264\]-RARBG.mp4/
ash-4.3# ls
ash-4.3# ls -al
total 0
ash-4.3#
```
#### What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
beta 1.42-038

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
linux

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
google drive

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

first i mount rclone line normal with:
`/volume1/rclone1.42-038/rclone mount this_one: /mnt/gdrive.de/ --allow-other --config=/volume1/rclone1.40.conf --cache-db-path=/volume1/rclone_cache > /tmp/rclone.log 2>&1 &`
then i run:
`/volume1/rclone1.42-038/rclone mount cache_list: /volume1/Data/rclone_cache --config=/volume1/rclone1.40.conf --read-only --allow-other &
`
a copy of my config:
```
ash-4.3# cat rclone1.40.conf
[gdrive_mount]
type = drive
client_id = **********
client_secret = **********
scope = drive
root_folder_id =
service_account_file =
token = {"access_token":"**********","expiry":"2018-07-16T13:29:24.306204509+10:00"}

[cache]
type = cache
remote = gdrive_mount:
plex_url = http://127.0.0.1:32400
plex_username = ******
plex_password = *********
chunk_size = 5M
info_age = 12h
chunk_total_size = 10G
plex_token = ************

[this_one]
type = crypt
remote = cache:
filename_encryption = standard
directory_name_encryption = true
password = *************
password2 = **************

[cache_list]
type = crypt
remote = /volume1/rclone_cache/cache/
filename_encryption = standard
directory_name_encryption = true
password = ***************
password2 = ***************
ash-4.3#
```

issue.title: Add support for '-l' option

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?
Add support for the '-l' option, translating symbolic links. 


#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

[issue 1152](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/1152)

#### Checklist

- [X] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [X] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [ ] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

issue.title: No access when using shared folders in Mega

milestone.title: Known Problem
milestone.description: This milestone contains issues which are known problems which are proving difficult to fix, or are awaiting an external fix or we haven't got round to yet.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you are reporting a bug or asking for a new feature then please use one of the templates here:

    https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/new

otherwise fill in the form below.

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->


#### Output of `rclone version`



#### Describe the issue

I found out that when I'm using shared folders in the mega account, rclone can't log in/ access to the mega account.

When I delete these sahred folders, rclone access (without any change in the account config) to the mega account files and folders without any problem.

Thank you for your work and efforts.

issue.title: serve sftp: Add support for public key with auth proxy - fixes #3572

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

Add support for #3572 (public key auth with auth proxy)

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

#3572

This is a slight modification of the discussion on the ticket, I made it match the behavior of user/pass when the proxy is involved. Instead of spitting back public keys that are acceptable, the proxy returns a backend config and a zero if the public key is acceptable. I did it this way for two reasons #1 consistency of behavior and #2 I want to be able to log specifics of an auth request and while I definitely don't send user passwords on to logging, I see real value in having the successful or failed public key to help a user debug a connectivity issue.

Let me know if you have any concerns or if I've goofed this up somehow, Thanks!

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

issue.title: Support new Google Drive shortcuts

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
So it seems that Google Drive finally deprecated the "Add to My Drive" option and replaced it with a better feature: shortcuts.

Currently, rclone ignores them completely.

There is more information about it in [the GSuite blog](https://gsuiteupdates.googleblog.com/2019/08/drive-shortcuts-beta.html), as the feature first rolled out to GSuite customers, but now is being [rolled out to all the accounts](https://www.androidpolice.com/2020/03/27/google-drive-file-shortcuts/). I've got them in my account, so I can help with testing if needed.

EDIT: Just found that [this has been discussed in the forums](https://forum.rclone.org/t/fyi-sep-30-new-google-drive-shortcuts-and-folder-structure/15197/6)

issue.title: Improve crypt overlay standard filename encryption to handle longer names

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Using rclone v1.50.2-DEV, when using crypt overlay with "standard" filename encryption, the usable filename length limit seems to be 143 characters.  In my testing, a 143-char long original filename ends up as a 231-char long "encrypted" filename on a remote with a 255-char real filename length limit.  That's a 44% reduction in usable filename length (255 to 143), which seems quite excessive.

Isn't there some more reasonable way to encode the filenames without so much space wasted on overhead?  For instance, I think a 20% loss to encoding overhead would be an absolute maximum limit, which would still allow for more than 200-chars of usable filename length compared to the current 143-char limit.  But even with an added 128bits of base64 encoded salt should only take up 22 chars, which should leave 233 chars of filename length usable.

issue.title: Shortcut remote

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is your current rclone version (output from `rclone version`)?

**1.51**

#### What problem are you are trying to solve?
I have a many schedules tasks with remotes like **MyDrive:path1/path2/path3/path4**

I would like to make my commands shorter.

#### How do you think rclone should be changed to solve that?
Would be great if I could simply make **shortcut remotes** by adding this to my config file:

```
[BackupRemote]
remote = MyDrive:path1/path2/path3/path4
```
So I can do **rclone ``whatever`` *source* BackupRemote:**

And it will wrap that long command into that single sentence. The shortcut will be a root, so children paths will work as well. So, for example, **BackupRemote:LivingRoomPC** is the equivalent of **MyDrive:path1/path2/path3/path4/LivingRoomPC**

issue.title: BUG? Undefined? behavior with  --cache-tmp-upload-path  cache/vfs

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    
If you can still replicate it with the latest beta, then please fill in the info below which makes our lives much easier.  A log with -vv will make our day :-)

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
Undefined? behavior with  --cache-tmp-upload-path

The back-end is a crypt on top of cache on top of Google Drive. Which I believe is the recommended way to do it?

When using --vfs-cache-mode write or full, without setting --cache-dir  or -cache-tmp-upload-path,  write caching doesn't work, but everything else works like normal. This is expected and this is OK.

`/usr/bin/rclone mount GD-TD-ABC-Cached-Xcrypt: /mypool/mount --daemon --fast-list --vfs-cache-mode full --dir-cache-time 60m --allow-other --allow-non-empty -`

When adding  -cache-tmp-upload-path=  (no --cache-dir), write  caching begins to work but not as expected.

If I use this command: 

`/usr/bin/rclone mount GD-TD-ABC-Cached-Xcrypt: /mypool/mount --cache-tmp-upload-path=~/fartsOnWheels --daemon --fast-list --vfs-cache-mode full --dir-cache-time 60m --allow-other --allow-non-empty -`

- **If  ~/fartsOnWheels does not exist.**
The write caching begins to work.
The log mentions the given directory.  
LOG:  Upload Temp FS: ~/fartsOnWheels
But the cache-tmp-upload directory of ~/fartsOnWheels is not obeyed and not created.
- **If  ~/fartsOnWheels does exist.**
The write caching begins to work.
The log mentions the given directory.  
 LOG:  Upload Temp FS: ~/fartsOnWheels
But the cache-tmp-upload directory of ~/fartsOnWheels is not obeyed
- **If  instead I give a full path /home/user/fartsOnWheels , it is created if it doesnt exist, otherwise it uses the existing and ...**
The write caching begins to work.
The log mentions the given directory.  
 LOG:   Upload Temp FS: /home/user/fartsOnWheels 
And the cache-tmp-upload directory of /home/user/fartsOnWheels is obeyed and fully functional.


**_In both first two cases, write caching begins to work, but the temp upload cache dir is automatically instead /home/user/.cache/rclone/vfs/GD-TD-ABC-Cached-Xcrypt/ (part of the vfs cache system!)_**

Now it turns out that the issue is because of not using full paths and instead using the (tilde glob) ~ character to indicate the user home folder.
In any case by giving a full path /home/user/fartsOnWheels/ the directly is correctly used.

**But the plot thickens**, if I put literally anything that isn't a full path, for example --cache-tmp-upload-path=yes it seems to fall back to the same behavior where the temp upload cache dir is /home/user/.cache/rclone/vfs/GD-TD-ABC-Cached-Xcrypt/

**Something else to note, while this undocumented automatic fallback enables the write cache to function, the files copied during this time for write, while in the undocumented fallback temp upload folder, are never encrypted (or names scrambled) while in this folder, although when they are uploaded fully on the destination they are properly encrypted.**

Example: File copied to the mount for upload, with the fallback temp active.
--cache-tmp-upload-path=~/fartsOnWheels 

```
 ls -la ~/.cache/rclone/vfs/GD-TD-ABC-Cached-Xcrypt/
 2013-cvma-scientific-presentation.pdf
```
(The file name is not scrambled in the temp staging area on disk)

LOG: INFO  : 6hr4ip2k9c481h9lhmu62tvqm2i4t8pikupd9iqpajfevm4kg49gb3nsb3v5qm9iq1r3e1jce4l3a: background upload: started upload


 In contrast to a more correctly working full path assigned for  --cache-tmp-upload-path=~/fartsOnWheels

Example: File copied to the mount for upload, with full path --cache-tmp-upload-path=~/fartsOnWheels

```
ls /tmp/fartsonwheels/
6hr4ip2k9c481h9lhmu62tvqm2i4t8pikupd9iqpajfevm4kg49gb3nsb3v5qm9iq1r3e1jce4l3a
```
(The file name is scrambled in the temp staging area on disk)

INFO  : 6hr4ip2k9c481h9lhmu62tvqm2i4t8pikupd9iqpajfevm4kg49gb3nsb3v5qm9iq1r3e1jce4l3a: background upload: started upload

In either case, the file is uploaded, name scrambled and encrypted correctly on the destination after.

So, quite honestly, the fact that the tilde doesn't seem to work for the path for the --cache-tmp-upload-path= could be due to many things, perhaps I need to put it in quotations? I don't know.

To be quite honest, the undefined behavior is actually closer to what I was trying to accomplish in the end..
I would prefer that a sane default for cache-tmp-upload-path would be the default, either in the cache-backend folder, or the vfs folder. And by using the tilde glob I was actually trying to put the staging area somewhere in the nearby area a.k.a the next best thing.

So, what do I wish would happen?
1. Would be great if the tilde glob was obeyed.
2. A sane default and documented temp upload area based on the defaults for the other cache methods would be great too.

Hope this made sense, it was quite difficult to figure out what was going on and difficult to explain it.


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

rclone v1.51.0
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.13.7


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Debian 10 Buster


####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive


#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
`/usr/bin/rclone mount GD-TD-ABCl-Cached-Xcrypt: /mypool/mount --cache-tmp-upload-path=literallyanythinghere --daemon --fast-list --vfs-cache-mode full --dir-cache-time 60m --allow-other --allow-non-empty -`

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

The service rclone has been started.

issue.title: operations: Add a download flag to hashsum and related commands to force rclone to download and hash files locally

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->
Add a download flag to hashsum and related commands to force rclone to download and hash files locally

<!--
Describe the changes here
-->

This commit modifies the operations.hashSum function by adding an alternate code path.  This code path is triggered by passing downloadFlag = True.  When activated, rclone will download files from the remote and hash them locally.  downloadFlag = False preserves the existing behavior of using the remote to retrieve the hash.

This commit modifies HashLister to support the new hashSum method as well as consolidating the roles of HashLister, HashListerBase64, Md5sum, and Sha1sum.

The unit test operations_test.TestHashSums is modified to support this change and test the download functionality.

The command functions hashsum, md5sum, sha1sum, and dbhashsum are modified to support this change.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

<!--
Link issues and relevant forum posts here.
-->

https://forum.rclone.org/t/force-download-hash/20333

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

This pull request requires functionality and project best practices review before finalization.

issue.title: Single-file copy failed with access denied when folder copy succeeds

milestone.title: Soon
milestone.description: Issues which are a good idea but haven't been assigned a specific release yet.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`
https://forum.rclone.org/t/s3-rclone-v-1-52-0-or-after-permission-denied/21961/13

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
Inconsistent behavior when using `copy` command for copying a folder as opposed to copying a single file. 
The symptom is that copying a single file fails (but succeeds when copying a folder to the same remote). 
The root-cause is that RCLONE tries to create the remote path (to avoid multiple API calls probably), which means attempting to create a remote *bucket* (a permission that is rarely given when using cloud storage). When that permission isn't given for the user, even if the bucket exists, cloud providers (e.g. S3) will return a "permission denied" error. 

This does not happen when copying a folder, as it seems like RCLONE always tries to list the remote folder prior to trying to copy. So if the bucket exists it will not attempt creating it.


Options to fix raised by @ncw :

1. Avoid creating a bucket altogether, unless `mkdir` is used. This is probably not a good idea as it's backwards incompatible.
2. Listing the remote folder prior to copying a single file. This is also a behavior change, as it adds an API call to single file copy operations (how frequent really is that?). Probably the cleanest option (there's the question of handling list permissions... need to look into that and I'll be happy to help).
3. Using the same existing flow (attempt creating remote path, thus implicitly creating the bucket), but doing something different upon retry (assuming the bucket exist maybe). According to Nick, this is probably more complex. 

Personally, I believe option #2 is the cleanest, both with respect to consistency with the copy behavior when copying a folder, and avoiding unneeded retries.


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
v1.55.0

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
MacOS Catalina 10.15.7 (but I'm sure this behavior is the same)

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
AWS S3

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
### The failed command (copying a single file):
```
$ rclone copy -vv bla/bla.txt s3-guy-test:guyarad-test
2021/04/23 21:43:24 DEBUG : Using config file from "/Users/guyarad/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2021/04/23 21:43:24 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.55.0" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "-vv" "bla/bla.txt" "s3-guy-test:guyarad-test"]
2021/04/23 21:43:24 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "bla/bla.txt"
2021/04/23 21:43:24 DEBUG : fs cache: adding new entry for parent of "bla/bla.txt", "/Users/guyarad/src/bla"
2021/04/23 21:43:24 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "s3-guy-test:guyarad-test"
2021/04/23 21:43:25 DEBUG : bla.txt: Need to transfer - File not found at Destination
2021/04/23 21:43:25 ERROR : bla.txt: Failed to copy: AccessDenied: Access Denied
	status code: 403, request id: EFK8TVZQ5HQTCH50, host id: j2tCf5VV9A/ChbRSE+eSY4cKsF/V690LMhQzL2VmegXaQVMxVC/31OgJqt95EDu0pbVcETVBJCo=
2021/04/23 21:43:25 ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 1 errors and: AccessDenied: Access Denied
	status code: 403, request id: EFK8TVZQ5HQTCH50, host id: j2tCf5VV9A/ChbRSE+eSY4cKsF/V690LMhQzL2VmegXaQVMxVC/31OgJqt95EDu0pbVcETVBJCo=
... RETRIES OMITTED ...
2021/04/23 21:43:25 INFO  :
Transferred:   	         0 / 0 Bytes, -, 0 Bytes/s, ETA -
Errors:                 1 (retrying may help)
Elapsed time:         1.6s

2021/04/23 21:43:25 DEBUG : 6 go routines active
2021/04/23 21:43:25 Failed to copy: AccessDenied: Access Denied
	status code: 403, request id: EFK822P9G8PJKPYF, host id: DvXHGARYgOW/8HFrf9iogUWMxvLxShAhMQ4AlPchDuPwNqweAXeyKPl4UbLDOaOX+IISOUJBENE=
```

### Successful copy with the same remote (copying a folder):
```
$ rclone copy -vv bla/ s3-guy-test:guyarad-test
2021/04/23 21:47:09 DEBUG : Using config file from "/Users/guyarad/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2021/04/23 21:47:09 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.55.0" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "-vv" "bla/" "s3-guy-test:guyarad-test"]
2021/04/23 21:47:09 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "bla/"
2021/04/23 21:47:09 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "bla/" to be canonical "/Users/guyarad/src/bla"
2021/04/23 21:47:09 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "s3-guy-test:guyarad-test"
2021/04/23 21:47:10 DEBUG : S3 bucket guyarad-test: Waiting for checks to finish
2021/04/23 21:47:10 DEBUG : S3 bucket guyarad-test: Waiting for transfers to finish
2021/04/23 21:47:10 DEBUG : bla.txt: MD5 = 3cd7a0db76ff9dca48979e24c39b408c OK
2021/04/23 21:47:10 INFO  : bla.txt: Copied (new)
2021/04/23 21:47:10 INFO  :
Transferred:   	         4 / 4 Bytes, 100%, 12 Bytes/s, ETA 0s
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:         1.1s

2021/04/23 21:47:10 DEBUG : 6 go routines active
```

### After adding CreateBucket policy to the same user being used
(single-file copy operation succeeds)
```
$ rclone copy -vv bla/bla.txt s3-guy-test:guyarad-test
2021/04/23 21:19:09 DEBUG : Using config file from "/Users/guyarad/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2021/04/23 21:19:09 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.55.0" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "-vv" "bla/bla.txt" 
2021/04/23 21:19:09 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "bla/bla.txt"
2021/04/23 21:19:09 DEBUG : fs cache: adding new entry for parent of "bla/bla.txt", "/Users/guyarad/src/bla"
2021/04/23 21:19:09 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "s3-guy-test:guyarad-test"
2021/04/23 21:19:10 DEBUG : bla.txt: Need to transfer - File not found at Destination
2021/04/23 21:19:10 INFO  : S3 bucket guyarad-test: Bucket "guyarad-test" created with ACL "private"
2021/04/23 21:19:11 DEBUG : bla.txt: MD5 = 3cd7a0db76ff9dca48979e24c39b408c OK
2021/04/23 21:19:11 INFO  : bla.txt: Copied (new)
2021/04/23 21:19:11 INFO  :
Transferred:   	         4 / 4 Bytes, 100%, 6 Bytes/s, ETA 0s
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:         1.4s

2021/04/23 21:19:11 DEBUG : 6 go routines active
```

Thanks guys for the awesome tool!!

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
### What is the purpose of this change?

Implement the `rclone bisync` command (port of [rclonesync](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2))

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Fixes #118

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-Q

### Action Items

- [x] Core functionality, first sync and dry run modes
- [x] Access health check
- [x] Filters file MD5 validation
- [x] Test engine for original test scenarios
- [x] Honor `--max-delete` flag
- [x] API endpoint `sync/bisync`
- [x] Basic test (`test_basic`) passes
- [x] Draft documentation
- [x] Really compare console logs
- [x] Make first-sync and dry-run tests pass
- [x] Implement ABORT/CRITICAL logic
- [x] Compatibility with `--legacy` messages and tests
- [x] Port README.md and TESTING.md
- [x] All tests pass on Local FS
- [x] All tests pass with Google Drive
- [x] All tests pass with Dropbox
- [x] Tests run and pass on Windows
- [x] Fix tests for Mailru
- [x] Fix tests for FTP (depends on #5283)
- [x] Fix tests for SFTP
- [x] Fix tests for AWS S3
- [x] Fix tests for Chunker/LocalFs (depends on #5297)
- [x] Put verbosity of bisync messages under control
- [x] Develop legacy free syntax for test scenarios
- [x] Keep hash in listings, if available (don't use for sync yet). See [rclonesync#5](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2/issues/5)
- [x] Parallelize all list/copy/delete operations for performance
- [x] Drop legacy support as soon as we are fully decoupled from the original project
- [x] Gracefully handle invalid UTF-8 in filenames. ([rcsync#62](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2/issues/62))
- [x] Handle files that change during a bisync run - _documented_ ([rcsync#24](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2/issues/24))
- [x] Fix remaining FIXMEs
- [x] Add original license, author and attributions
- [x] More docs: FILTERING.md, USAGE.md, TROUBLESHOOTING.md
- [x] Inventory bug reports from the original project

issue.title: bisync: beta time improvements

milestone.title: Help Wanted
milestone.description:
Enhancements which might be useful, but currently aren't planned.

Any help doing these much appreciated.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
### Intro

The bisync pull request #5164 appeared too large to fulfil in a single rclone release.

Plan is to merge it right after the rclone v1.57 release. The command will be available in the beta builds for a limited circle of beta testers until official release with rclone v1.58.
During the beta period we can merge a number of postponed items, **in particular breaking changes**.

This ticket will keep track of the most beta time changes. Large and critical changes will be split into separate tickets.
High priority items reflect changes breaking user experience and must be completed before 1.58. Medium priority items are required but not guaranteed by 1.58. Optional and low priority items will be implemented on best effort basis. Optional items don't even have dedicated tickets yet.

### High priority

- [ ] Track critical flags in saved sessions - #5678
- [ ] Support imprecise or absent modtimes - #5679
- [ ] Use hashsums, honor `--checksum` - #5683

### Medium priority

- [ ] Check file sizes - #5684
- [ ] Respect `--backup-dir` - #5685
- [ ] Align `--max-delete` semantics - #5680
- [ ] Optimize resync - #5681
- [ ] Track renames - #5690

### Low priority

- [ ] Handle deletion conflicts - #5691
- [ ] Honor `--interactive` and `--auto-confirm`
- [ ] Recover after transient failures - #5676
- [ ] Use **trie** for listings to reduce footprint - #5686
- [ ] Maintain session history - #5692
- [ ] Handle Google Docs better - #5696

### Optional items

- [ ] Parallelize move/rename operations
- [ ] Honor special `.rcignore` files
- [ ] Revisit progress display for bisync
- [ ] Handle case-insensitive filenames. Respect `--ignore-case` and `--ignore-case-sync` ([rcsync#54](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2/issues/54), [#4854](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4854))
- [ ] Synchronize empty dirs if supported by backend ([rcsync#63](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2/issues/63))
- [ ] Fix tests for Google Photos ([rcsync#53](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2/issues/53), [G.Photos issues](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Remote%3A+Google+Photos%22))
- [ ] Enable CI tests with OwnCloud (according to @cjnaz it's stable)
- [ ] Test should handle Dropbox "touch quirks" in a generic way

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the  [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.

issue.title: bisync: handle volatile changes consistently

milestone.title: Soon
milestone.description: Issues which are a good idea but haven't been assigned a specific release yet.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
## Synopsis

This problem can be also title `recover after transient failures`.

@cjnaz once wrote in https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/5164#issuecomment-843406665

One perpetual problem I ran into was with a dynamically changing file system.  rclonesync is not robust for the case of a file no longer there after the current LSL snapshot was taken.  Also, if a file is being written to / blocked when rclonesync wants to copy it.  In such cases rclonesync throws up its hands and forces user interaction via a `--resync`.

## Prior discussions

Related to https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2/issues/56
Related to #1316

### https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/5164#issuecomment-843426747 (JWink3101)

I agree with these issues of sorts. This isn't new in rclone either. If you change the filesystem while it is running, things can break. For my tool, I [enumated what would happen](https://github.com/Jwink3101/syncrclone/blob/master/docs/misc.md#interruptions) if it is interrupted. Something similar happens if a file changes.

But again, this is the beauty of the not-using-history-to-make-a-changelog approach (\#2). You only need history to figure out what to do!. So if a file was  added between the lsl, it will still copy.

### https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/5164#issuecomment-843460561 (ivandeex)

Pretty close to #840 (recheck source during operation, open)
Related to #3770 (_.partial_ file support in LocalFS / FTP / SFTP, which can be _filtered out_ by bisync)

Covered by postponed item "Use temporary files with FTP, SFTP"
I guess it will change nothing in bisync but improve FTP/SFTP and only add related tests to bisync.

### https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/5164#issuecomment-843851607 (ivandeex)

@cjnaz

> 
> > rclonesync is not robust for the case of a file no longer there after the current LSL snapshot was taken.

Such files should be just **skipped** (by default or under a command-line flag) similar to https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/5297#pullrequestreview-649944326

> 
> > Also, if a file is being written to / blocked when rclonesync wants to copy it.  In such cases rclonesync throws up its hands and forces user interaction via a --first-sync.
>
> Pretty close to #840 (recheck source during operation, open)
> Related to #3770 (_.partial_ file support in LocalFS / FTP / SFTP, which can be _filtered out_ by bisync)

I think rclonesync approach is right. If bisync detects a mutating file, it should abort operation or just skip the file (depending on a flag e.g. `--force`), then request a resync **and recommend adding this file to a filter.**

### https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/5164#issuecomment-844237183 (cjnaz)

One critical design feature / flaw / weakness of rclonesync is that at the
end of the operation the two paths, and thus the two LSL files must match.
If not, then the sync has failed and a --first-sync is forced.  So if an
individual file can't be copied then there is no recovery other than a
--first-sync.  In the future this will be something to be fixed - so that
transient out-of-sync can be recovered from.  Perhaps track mismatches and
retry in the next run?

## How to use GitHub

* Please use the  [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.

issue.title: SFTP and new provider borgbase.com

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hi All!

The [list of providers](https://rclone.org/#providers) is Rsync.net and SFTP (SSH).
Does this mean that it can work with the [Rsync.net version for Borgbackup](https://www.rsync.net/products/borg.html)?
If so, can you add native support for [Borgbase.com](https://www.borgbase.com/)?
A fantastic service dedicated to Borg, also used SSH.
(Also developer and sponsor [Vorta](https://vorta.borgbase.com/) - GUI for Borg)

Best Regards!

issue.title: New --links parameter not working with mount?

milestone.title: Soon
milestone.description: Issues which are a good idea but haven't been assigned a specific release yet.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

I uploaded some symlinks with "rclone copy" and parameter "--links" to my gdrive remote.
As expected, files with the extension "rclonelink" are generated.

I now expect that the rclonelink files are not visible via rclone mount. Instead they should be translated to symlinks. But actually it is not the case. Only plain rclonelink files are visible.

Additionally I'm also not able to create symlink. Instead I get I/O error (see below).


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
rclone v1.46-DEV (latest commit as of today)


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Linux x64


####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive


#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone --config /config/rclone.conf mount gdrive_decrypted:/ /mnt --allow-other --allow-non-empty --uid=1000 --gid=1000 --umask=007 --links --fast-list --rc--verbose


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
ln -s /tmp/testfile testlink
ln: testlink: I/O error
